cards.name: Oddish
cards.text: If exposed to moonlight, it starts to move. It roams far and wide at night to scatter its seeds.

attacks.name: Leaf Boomerang
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage for each heads.

cards.name: Gloom
cards.text: Its pistils exude an incredibly foul odor. The horrid stench can cause fainting at a distance of 1.25 miles.

attacks.name: Offensive Scent
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused and Poisoned.

cards.name: Bellossom
cards.text: Plentiful in the tropics. When it dances, its petals rub together and make a pleasant ringing sound.

attacks.name: Flower Spin
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 80 damage for each heads. Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Tangela
cards.text: Hidden beneath a tangle of vines that grows nonstop even if the vines are torn off, this Pokémon's true appearance remains a mystery.

cards.name: Tangrowth
cards.text: Tangrowth has two arms that it can extend as it pleases. Recent research has shown that these arms are, in fact, bundles of vines.

attacks.name: Suctioning Vines
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Scyther
cards.text: As Scyther fights more and more battles, its scythes become sharper and sharper. With a single slice, Scyther can fell a massive tree.

attacks.name: Mach Cut
attacks.text: Discard a Special Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Sunkern
cards.text: It lives by drinking only dewdrops from under the leaves of plants. It is said that it eats nothing else.

cards.name: Yanma
cards.text: If it flaps its wings really fast, it can generate shock waves that will shatter windows in the area.

attacks.name: Swoop Across
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Yanmega
cards.text: This six-legged Pokémon is easily capable of transporting an adult in flight. The wings on its tail help it stay balanced.

attacks.name: Shoot Through
attacks.text: This attack also does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Jet Wing
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

cards.name: Kricketot
cards.text: When its antennae hit each other, it sounds like the music of a xylophone.

attacks.name: Trip Over
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

cards.name: Cherubi
cards.text: The deeper a Cherubi's red, the more nutrients it has stockpiled in its body. And the sweeter and tastier its small ball!

cards.name: Carnivine
cards.text: It binds itself to trees in marshes. It attracts prey with its sweet-smelling drool and gulps them down.

attacks.name: Festering Saliva
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned and Poisoned.

attacks.name: Bind Down
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

cards.name: Leafeon V
cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Leaf Guard
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Slashing Strike
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't use Slashing Strike.

cards.name: Leafeon VSTAR

abilities.name: Ivy Star
abilities.text: During your turn, you may switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 VSTAR Power in a game.)

cards.text: VSTAR rule: When your Pokémon VSTAR is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Leaf Guard
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.name: Grubbin
cards.text: It uses its big jaws to dig nests into the forest floor, and it loves to feed on sweet tree sap.

attacks.name: Energize
attacks.text: Attach a Lightning Energy card from your discard pile to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Surprise Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Zarude
cards.text: Within dense forests, this Pokémon lives in a pack with others of its kind. It's incredibly aggressive, and the other Pokémon of the forest fear it.

attacks.name: Drag Off
attacks.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to the new Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Triple Whip
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 70 damage for each heads.

cards.name: Calyrex
cards.text: Calyrex is a merciful Pokémon, capable of providing healing and blessings. It reigned over the Galar region in times of yore.

attacks.name: King's Instructions
attacks.text: You may search your deck for up to 2 cards and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Bloomshine
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from each of your Pokémon.

cards.name: Charizard V
cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Incinerate
attacks.text: Before doing damage, discard all Pokémon Tools from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Charizard VSTAR
cards.text: VSTAR rule: When your Pokémon VSTAR is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Explosive Fire
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any damage counters on it, this attack does 100 more damage.

attacks.name: Star Blaze
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 VSTAR Power in a game.)

cards.name: Radiant Charizard

abilities.name: Excited Heart
abilities.text: This Pokémon's attacks cost Colorless less for each Prize card your opponent has taken.

cards.text: It spits fire that is hot enough to melt boulders. It may cause forest fires by blowing flames.

attacks.name: Combustion Blast
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't use Combustion Blast.

cards.name: Entei

abilities.name: Explosive Heat Dash
abilities.text: If this Pokémon has any Fire Energy attached, it has no Retreat Cost.

cards.text: It is said that when it roars, a volcano erupts somewhere around the globe.

cards.name: Simisear V
cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Bursting Power
attacks.text: You may attach up to 2 basic Energy cards from your hand to your Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Flare Juggling
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Simisear VSTAR
cards.text: VSTAR rule: When your Pokémon VSTAR is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Fireball Fever
attacks.text: You may discard up to 5 cards from the top of your deck. This attack does 40 more damage for each card you discarded in this way.

attacks.name: Ember Star
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage for each Energy card in your discard pile. (You can't use more than 1 VSTAR Power in a game.)

cards.name: Larvesta
cards.text: The people of ancient times believed that Larvesta fell from the sun.

cards.name: Volcarona
cards.text: Volcarona scatters burning scales. Some say it does this to start fires. Others say it's trying to rescue those that suffer in the cold.

attacks.name: Volcanic Heat
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

cards.name: Volcanion
cards.text: It expels its internal steam from the arms on its back. It has enough power to blow away a mountain.

attacks.name: Hydro Burn
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any Water Energy attached, this attack does 80 more damage.

cards.name: Salandit
cards.text: Its venom sacs produce a fluid that this Pokémon then heats up with the flame in its tail. This process creates Salandit's poisonous gas.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

cards.name: Salazzle
cards.text: Only female Salazzle exist. They emit a gas laden with pheromones to captivate male Salandit.

attacks.name: Tail Trickery
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Super Singe
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

cards.name: Seel
cards.text: Thanks to its thick fat, cold seas don't bother it at all, but it gets tired pretty easily in warm waters.

cards.name: Galarian Mr. Mime
cards.text: It can radiate chilliness from the bottoms of its feet. It'll spend the whole day tap-dancing on a frozen floor.

attacks.name: Find It
attacks.text: Search your deck for an Item card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

cards.name: Wailmer
cards.text: It shows off by spraying jets of seawater from the nostrils above its eyes. It eats a solid ton of Wishiwashi every day.

attacks.name: Nap
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Wailord
cards.text: It can sometimes knock out opponents with the shock created by breaching and crashing its big body onto the water.

attacks.name: Bubble Drain
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Corphish
cards.text: No matter how dirty the water in the river, it will adapt and thrive. It has a strong will to survive.

cards.name: Snorunt
cards.text: It can only survive in cold areas. It bounces happily around, even in environments as cold as -150 degrees Fahrenheit.

cards.name: Luvdisc
cards.text: Luvdisc makes its home in coral reefs in warm seas. It especially likes sleeping in the space between Corsola's branches.

attacks.name: Emotional Draw
attacks.text: Shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, draw 5 cards.

cards.name: Kyogre
cards.text: It is said to have widened the seas by causing downpours. It had been asleep in a marine trench.

attacks.name: Wave Summoning
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Water Energy card and attach it to this Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Dynamic Wave
attacks.text: Put 3 Energy attached to this Pokémon into your hand. This attack does 180 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Kyogre V
cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Dual Splash
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage to 2 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Aqua Typhoon
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't use Aqua Typhoon.

cards.name: Glaceon V
cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Frost Charge
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Water Energy card and attach it to this Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

cards.name: Shinx
cards.text: All of its fur dazzles if danger is sensed. It flees while the foe is momentarily blinded.

cards.name: Shinx
cards.text: This Pokémon generates electricity by contracting its muscles. Excited trembling is a sign that Shinx is generating a tremendous amount of electricity.

attacks.name: Thunder Jolt
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 10 damage to itself.

cards.name: Luxio
cards.text: Strong electricity courses through the tips of its sharp claws. A light scratch causes fainting in foes.

attacks.name: Jumping Kick
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Luxio
cards.text: By joining its tail with that of another Luxio, this Pokémon can receive some of the other Luxio's electricity and power up its own electric blasts.

attacks.name: Shorting Spark
attacks.text: This attack does 90 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon that has a Pokémon Tool attached. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Luxray
cards.text: Luxray's ability to see through objects comes in handy when it's scouting for danger.

attacks.name: Electrostep
attacks.text: This attack does 40 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Scar Strikes
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 100 more damage.

cards.name: Luxray

abilities.name: Explosiveness
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is in your hand when you are setting up to play, you may put it face down as your Active Pokémon.

cards.text: Luxray can see through solid objects. It will instantly spot prey trying to hide behind walls, even if the walls are thick.

attacks.name: Seeking Fang
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Trainer cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

cards.name: Rotom V

abilities.name: Instant Charge
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may draw 3 cards. If you use this Ability, your turn ends.

cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Scrap Short
attacks.text: Put any number of Pokémon Tool cards from your discard pile in the Lost Zone. This attack does 40 more damage for each card you put in the Lost Zone in this way.

cards.name: Rotom VSTAR

abilities.name: Conversion Star
abilities.text: During your turn, you may use this Ability. Discard any number of cards from your hand. Then, draw that many cards. (You can't use more than 1 VSTAR Power in a game.)

cards.text: VSTAR rule: When your Pokémon VSTAR is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Scrap Pulse
attacks.text: Put any number of Pokémon Tool cards from your discard pile in the Lost Zone. This attack does 40 more damage for each card you put in the Lost Zone in this way.

cards.name: Emolga
cards.text: As it flies, it scatters electricity around, so bird Pokémon keep their distance. That's why Emolga can keep all its food to itself.

attacks.name: Thunder Shock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Eelektrik

abilities.name: Ad Hoc Shock
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.text: These Pokémon have a big appetite. When they spot their prey, they attack it and paralyze it with electricity.

cards.name: Helioptile
cards.text: When spread, the frills on its head act like solar panels, generating the power behind this Pokémon's electric moves.

cards.name: Heliolisk
cards.text: A now-vanished desert culture treasured these Pokémon. Appropriately, when Heliolisk came to the Galar region, treasure came with them.

attacks.name: Wild Charge
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 50 damage to itself.

cards.name: Radiant Charjabug

abilities.name: Shocking Block
abilities.text: Whenever any player attaches an Energy card from their hand to 1 of their Pokémon V, put 2 damage counters on that Pokémon.

cards.text: While its durable shell protects it from attacks, Charjabug strikes at enemies with jolts of electricity discharged from the tips of its jaws.

attacks.name: Linear Attack
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Zeraora
cards.text: It approaches its enemies at the speed of lightning, then tears them limb from limb with its sharp claws.

attacks.name: Wild Charge
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 20 damage to itself.

cards.name: Zeraora V
cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Thunderous Bolt
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

cards.name: Zeraora VMAX
cards.text: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Reactive Pulse
attacks.text: This attack does 60 damage for each of your opponent's Pokémon in play that has an Ability.

attacks.name: Max Fist
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Zeraora VSTAR
cards.text: VSTAR rule: When your Pokémon VSTAR is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Crushing Beat
attacks.text: You may discard a Stadium in play.

attacks.name: Lightning Storm Star
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon 4 times. (You can choose the same Pokémon more than once.) For each time you chose a Pokémon, do 60 damage to it. This damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance. (You can't use more than 1 VSTAR Power in a game.)

cards.name: Pincurchin
cards.text: It feeds on seaweed, using its teeth to scrape it off rocks. Electric current flows from the tips of its spines.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Continuous Tumble
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 more damage for each heads.

cards.name: Exeggcute
cards.text: Though it may look like it's just a bunch of eggs, it's a proper Pokémon. Exeggcute communicates with others of its kind via telepathy, apparently.

attacks.name: Psy Bolt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Exeggutor
cards.text: Each of Exeggutor's three heads is thinking different thoughts. The three don't seem to be very interested in one another.

attacks.name: Powerful Storm
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage for each Energy attached to all of your Pokémon.

cards.name: Mewtwo
cards.text: A Pokémon created by recombining Mew's genes. It's said to have the most savage heart among Pokémon.

attacks.name: Psypump
attacks.text: Attach up to 2 Psychic Energy cards from your discard pile to 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Limit Break
attacks.text: If your opponent has 3 or fewer Prize cards remaining, this attack does 90 more damage.

cards.name: Mew V
cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Energy Mix
attacks.text: Search your deck for an Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Fusion Strike Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Psychic Leap
attacks.text: You may shuffle this Pokémon and all attached cards into your deck.

cards.name: Girafarig
cards.text: Its tail has a small brain of its own. Beware! If you get close, it may react to your scent by biting.

attacks.name: Double Draw
attacks.text: Draw 2 cards.

attacks.name: Psybeam
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.name: Lunatone
cards.text: The phase of the moon apparently has some effect on its power. It's active on the night of a full moon.

attacks.name: Cycle Draw
attacks.text: Discard a card from your hand. If you do, draw 3 cards.

attacks.name: Moon Kinesis
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Psychic Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Dusclops
cards.text: Its body is entirely hollow. When it opens its mouth, it sucks everything in as if it were a black hole.

attacks.name: Fade to Black
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.name: Tapu Lele
cards.text: Although called a guardian deity, Tapu Lele is devoid of guilt about its cruel disposition and can be described as nature incarnate.

attacks.name: Energy Burst
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage for each Energy attached to both Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Spiral Drain
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Hatterene V
cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Horoscope
attacks.text: Look at the top 3 cards of your deck. You may attach any number of Energy cards you find there to this Pokémon. Put the other cards back in any order.

attacks.name: Teleportation Burst
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Hatterene VMAX

abilities.name: Witch's Domain
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may move up to 2 damage counters from your Pokémon to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.text: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: G-Max Smite
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.name: Enamorus
cards.text: When it flies to this land from across the sea, the bitter winter comes to an end. According to legend, this Pokémon's love gives rise to the budding of fresh life across Hisui.

attacks.name: Draining Kiss
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Loving Sympathy
attacks.text: If you have the same number of cards in your hand as your opponent, this attack does 70 more damage.

cards.name: Graveler
cards.text: It travels by rolling down cliffs. If it falls into a river, it will explode with its last gasp.

cards.name: Solrock

abilities.name: Sun Energy
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may attach a Psychic Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Lunatone.

cards.text: When it rotates itself, it gives off light similar to the sun, thus blinding its foes.

cards.name: Baltoy
cards.text: It was discovered in ancient ruins. While moving, it constantly spins. It stands on one foot even when asleep.

cards.name: Riolu
cards.text: It's exceedingly energetic, with enough stamina to keep running all through the night. Taking it for walks can be a challenging experience.

cards.name: Pancham
cards.text: It chooses a Pangoro as its master and then imitates its master's actions. This is how it learns to battle and hunt for prey.

cards.name: Rockruff
cards.text: This Pokémon can bond very strongly with its Trainer, but it also has a habit of biting. Raising a Rockruff for a long time can be challenging.

attacks.name: Invite Out
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Lycanroc
cards.text: This form of Lycanroc is reckless. It charges headlong at its opponents, attacking without any care about what injuries it might receive.

attacks.name: Midnight Fang
attacks.text: This attack does 80 less damage for each Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Koffing
cards.text: It adores polluted air. Some claim that Koffing used to be more plentiful in the Galar region than they are now.

attacks.name: Smog
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.name: Absol
cards.text: Swift as the wind, Absol races through fields and mountains. Its curved, bow-like horn is acutely sensitive to the warning signs of natural disasters.

attacks.name: Lost Claw
attacks.text: Put a random card from your opponent's hand in the Lost Zone.

cards.name: Purrloin
cards.text: It steals things from people just to amuse itself with their frustration. A rivalry exists between this Pokémon and Nickit.

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage for each heads.

cards.name: Liepard
cards.text: Don't be fooled by its gorgeous fur and elegant figure. This is a moody and vicious Pokémon.

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 40 damage for each heads.

cards.name: Krokorok
cards.text: It buries some of its prey in the sand to use as emergency meals when its hunts are unsuccessful.

attacks.name: Dredge Up
attacks.text: Discard the top 3 cards of your opponent's deck.

cards.name: Pangoro
cards.text: This Pokémon is quick to anger, and it has no problem using its prodigious strength to get its way. It lives for duels against Obstagoon.

attacks.name: Wild Tackle
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.

cards.name: Skrelp
cards.text: It drifts in the ocean, blending in with floating seaweed. When other Pokémon come to feast on the seaweed, Skrelp feasts on them instead.

cards.name: Dragalge
cards.text: Dragalge uses a poisonous liquid capable of corroding metal to send tankers that enter its territory to the bottom of the sea.

attacks.name: Rocket Poison
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned. If this Pokémon evolved from Skrelp during this turn, put 8 damage counters on that Pokémon instead of 1 during Pokémon Checkup.

cards.name: Hoopa
cards.text: It gathers things it likes and passes them through its loop to teleport them to a secret place.

attacks.name: Assault Gate
attacks.text: If this Pokémon didn't move from the Bench to the Active Spot this turn, this attack does nothing. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness.

cards.name: Galarian Meowth
cards.text: Living with a savage, seafaring people has toughened this Pokémon's body so much that parts of it have turned to iron.

attacks.name: Fasten Claws
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

cards.name: Galarian Perrserker
cards.text: What appears to be an iron helmet is actually hardened hair. This Pokémon lives for the thrill of battle.

attacks.name: Sharp Claws
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 60 more damage.

cards.name: Scizor
cards.text: Bulky pincers account for one third of Scizor's body weight. A single swing of one of these pincers will crush a boulder completely.

attacks.name: X-Scissor
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Dangerous Claws
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Basic Pokémon, this attack does 80 more damage.

cards.name: Aron
cards.text: It eats iron ore—and sometimes railroad tracks— to build up the steel armor that protects its body.

attacks.name: Slight Intrusion
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 10 damage to itself.

cards.name: Lairon
cards.text: Lairon live in mountains brimming with spring water and iron ore, so these Pokémon often came into conflict with humans in the past.

attacks.name: Wreak Havoc
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, discard the top card of your opponent's deck.

cards.name: Aggron
cards.text: Aggron has a horn sharp enough to perforate thick iron sheets. It brings down its opponents by ramming into them horn first.

attacks.name: Counter Press
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, if this Pokémon is damaged by an attack (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), put damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon equal to the damage done to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Metang
cards.text: Two Beldum have become stuck together via their own magnetic forces. With two brains, the resulting Metang has doubled psychic powers.

attacks.name: Bullet Punch
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 more damage for each heads.

cards.name: Pawniard
cards.text: It uses river stones to maintain the cutting edges of the blades covering its body. These sharpened blades allow it to bring down opponents.

attacks.name: Reckless Charge
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 10 damage to itself.

cards.name: Pawniard
cards.text: It uses river stones to maintain the cutting edges of the blades covering its body. These sharpened blades allow it to bring down opponents.

cards.name: Bisharp
cards.text: It's accompanied by a large retinue of Pawniard. Bisharp keeps a keen eye on its minions, ensuring none of them even think of double-crossing it.

attacks.name: Spike Draw
attacks.text: Draw 2 cards.

cards.name: Zacian
cards.text: Now armed with a weapon it used in ancient times, this Pokémon needs only a single strike to fell even Gigantamax Pokémon.

attacks.name: Battle Legion
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each of your Benched Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Zacian V
cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Piercing Strike
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance, or by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Behemoth Blade
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Pokémon VMAX, this attack does 160 more damage.

cards.name: Zacian VSTAR
cards.text: VSTAR rule: When your Pokémon VSTAR is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Break Edge
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance, or by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Sword Star
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself. (You can't use more than 1 VSTAR Power in a game.)

cards.name: Zamazenta

abilities.name: Metal Shield
abilities.text: If this Pokémon has any Energy attached, it takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.text: Its ability to deflect any attack led to it being known as the Fighting Master's Shield. It was feared and respected by all.

attacks.name: Retaliate
attacks.text: If any of your Pokémon were Knocked Out during your opponent's last turn, this attack does 120 more damage.

cards.name: Zamazenta V

abilities.name: Regal Stance
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may discard your hand and draw 5 cards. If you use this Ability, your turn ends.

cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Revenge Blast
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Prize card your opponent has taken.

cards.name: Zamazenta VSTAR

abilities.name: Shield Star
abilities.text: During your turn, you may use this Ability. During your opponent's next turn, all of your Pokémon take 100 less damage from attacks from your opponent's Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance). (This includes Pokémon that come into play during this turn or during your opponent's next turn.) (You can't use more than 1 VSTAR Power in a game.)

cards.text: VSTAR rule: When your Pokémon VSTAR is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Giga Impact
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

cards.name: Rayquaza V
cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Dragon Pulse
attacks.text: Discard the top 2 cards of your deck.

attacks.name: Spiral Burst
attacks.text: You may discard up to 2 basic Fire Energy or up to 2 basic Lightning Energy from this Pokémon. This attack does 80 more damage for each card you discarded in this way.

cards.name: Rayquaza VMAX

abilities.name: Azure Pulse
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may discard your hand and draw 3 cards.

cards.text: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Max Burst
attacks.text: You may discard any amount of basic Fire Energy or any amount of basic Lightning Energy from this Pokémon. This attack does 80 more damage for each card you discarded in this way.

cards.name: Rayquaza VMAX

abilities.name: Azure Pulse
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may discard your hand and draw 3 cards.

cards.text: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Max Burst
attacks.text: You may discard any amount of basic Fire Energy or any amount of basic Lightning Energy from this Pokémon. This attack does 80 more damage for each card you discarded in this way.

cards.name: Duraludon V
cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Breaking Swipe
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon's attacks do 30 less damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.name: Duraludon VMAX

abilities.name: Skyscraper
abilities.text: Prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from your opponent's Pokémon that have Special Energy attached.

cards.text: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: G-Max Pulverization
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Radiant Eternatus

abilities.name: Climactic Gate
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may search your deck for up to 2 Pokémon VMAX and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck. If you use this Ability, your turn ends.

cards.text: The core on its chest absorbs energy emanating from the lands of the Galar region. This energy is what allows Eternatus to stay active.

cards.name: Tauros
cards.text: When Tauros begins whipping itself with its tails, it's a warning that the Pokémon is about to charge with astounding speed.

attacks.name: Adrena-Tackle
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has no damage counters on it, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Ditto

abilities.name: Sudden Transformation
abilities.text: This Pokémon can use the attacks of any Basic Pokémon in your discard pile, except for Pokémon with a Rule Box (Pokémon V, Pokémon-GX, etc. have Rule Boxes). (You still need the necessary Energy to use each attack.)

cards.text: It can reconstitute its entire cellular structure to change into what it sees, but it returns to normal when it relaxes.

cards.name: Eevee V
cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Vee Brave
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Pokémon V, this attack does 80 more damage.

cards.name: Snorlax
cards.text: This Pokémon's stomach is so strong, even eating moldy or rotten food will not affect it.

cards.name: Starly
cards.text: They flock around mountains and fields, chasing after bug Pokémon. Their singing is noisy and annoying.

attacks.name: Claw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Bidoof

abilities.name: Carefree Countenance
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks (both yours and your opponent's).

cards.text: It constantly gnaws on logs and rocks to whittle down its front teeth. It nests alongside water.

attacks.name: Hyper Fang
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Chatot
cards.text: It can learn and speak human words. If they gather, they all learn the same saying.

attacks.name: Cycle Draw
attacks.text: Discard a card from your hand. If you do, draw 2 cards.

cards.name: Regigigas V
cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Angry Whack
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon. This Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.name: Regigigas VSTAR

abilities.name: Star Guardian
abilities.text: During your turn, if your opponent has exactly 1 Prize card remaining, you may choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. They discard that Pokémon and all attached cards. (You can't use more than 1 VSTAR Power in a game.)

cards.text: VSTAR rule: When your Pokémon VSTAR is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Giga Impact
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

cards.name: Shaymin
cards.text: The blooming of Gracidea flowers confers the power of flight upon it. Feelings of gratitude are the message it delivers.

attacks.name: Gather Flowers
attacks.text: Shuffle up to 2 Energy cards from your discard pile into your deck.

cards.name: Stoutland V
cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Double Dip Fangs
attacks.text: If your opponent's Basic Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from this attack, take 1 more Prize card.

attacks.name: Wild Tackle
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.

cards.name: Yungoos
cards.text: Although it will eat anything, it prefers fresh living things, so it marches down streets in search of prey.

cards.name: Gumshoos
cards.text: Patient by nature, this Pokémon loses control of itself and pounces when it spots its favorite meal—Rattata!

attacks.name: Stakeout Headbutt
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon moved from the Bench to the Active Spot during your opponent's last turn, this attack does 120 more damage.

cards.name: Oranguru
cards.text: With waves of its fan—made from leaves and its own fur—Oranguru skillfully gives instructions to other Pokémon.

attacks.name: Primate Acting
attacks.text: Choose a Supporter card from your opponent's discard pile and use the effect of that card as the effect of this attack.

cards.name: Greedent V
cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Body Slam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Nom-Nom-Nom Incisors
attacks.text: Draw 3 cards.

cards.name: Wooloo
cards.text: Its curly fleece is such an effective cushion that this Pokémon could fall off a cliff and stand right back up at the bottom, unharmed.

attacks.name: Rolling Rollout
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 damage for each heads.

cards.name: Dubwool
cards.text: Weave a carpet from its springy wool, and you end up with something closer to a trampoline. You'll start to bounce the moment you set foot on it.

attacks.name: Overhead Throw
attacks.text: This attack also does 10 damage to 1 of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Rolling Dash
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 more damage for each heads.

cards.name: Bea
cards.text: Discard the top 5 cards of your deck, and attach any Energy cards you discarded in this way to your Benched Fighting Pokémon in any way you like.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

cards.name: Bede
cards.text: Attach a basic Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

cards.name: Crushing Hammer
cards.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy from 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.,You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

cards.name: Digging Duo
cards.text: Flip a coin. If heads, look at the bottom 8 cards of your deck and put 1 of them into your hand. If tails, look at the bottom 3 cards of your deck and put 1 of them into your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

cards.name: Energy Retrieval
cards.text: Put up to 2 basic Energy cards from your discard pile into your hand.,You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

cards.name: Energy Search
cards.text: Search your deck for a basic Energy card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.,You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

cards.name: Energy Switch
cards.text: Move a basic Energy from 1 of your Pokémon to another of your Pokémon.,You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

cards.name: Friends in Hisui
cards.text: Draw 3 cards.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

cards.name: Friends in Sinnoh
cards.text: Draw 3 cards.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

cards.name: Great Ball
cards.text: Look at the top 7 cards of your deck. You may reveal a Pokémon you find there and put it into your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.,You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

cards.name: Hop
cards.text: Draw 3 cards.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

cards.name: Leon
cards.text: During this turn, your Pokémon's attacks do 30 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

cards.name: Lost Vacuum
cards.text: You can use this card only if you put another card from your hand in the Lost Zone. Choose a Pokémon Tool attached to any Pokémon, or any Stadium in play, and put it in the Lost Zone.,You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

cards.name: Nessa
cards.text: Put up to 4 in any combination of Water Pokémon and Water Energy cards from your discard pile into your hand.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

cards.name: Poké Ball
cards.text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.,You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

cards.name: Pokémon Catcher
cards.text: Flip a coin. If heads, switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon.,You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

cards.name: Potion
cards.text: Heal 30 damage from 1 of your Pokémon.,You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

cards.name: Raihan
cards.text: You can play this card only if any of your Pokémon were Knocked Out during your opponent's last turn. Attach a basic Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Pokémon. If you do, search your deck for a card and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

cards.name: Rare Candy
cards.text: Choose 1 of your Basic Pokémon in play. If you have a Stage 2 card in your hand that evolves from that Pokémon, put that card onto the Basic Pokémon to evolve it, skipping the Stage 1. You can't use this card during your first turn or on a Basic Pokémon that was put into play this turn.,You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

cards.name: Rescue Carrier
cards.text: Put up to 2 Pokémon, each with 90 HP or less, from your discard pile into your hand.,You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

cards.name: Sky Seal Stone

abilities.name: Star Order
abilities.text: During your turn, you may use this Ability. During this turn, if your opponent's Active Pokémon VSTAR or Active Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out by damage from an attack from your Basic Pokémon V, take 1 more Prize card. (You can't use more than 1 VSTAR Power in a game.)

cards.text: The Pokémon V this card is attached to can use the VSTAR Power on this card.,You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.,Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached.

cards.name: Switch
cards.text: Switch your Active Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.,You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

cards.name: Trekking Shoes
cards.text: Look at the top card of your deck. You may put that card into your hand. If you don't, discard that card and draw a card.,You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

cards.name: Ultra Ball
cards.text: You can use this card only if you discard 2 other cards from your hand. Search your deck for a Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.,You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

cards.name: Elesa's Sparkle
cards.text: Choose up to 2 of your Fusion Strike Pokémon. For each of those Pokémon, search your deck for a Fusion Strike Energy card and attach it to that Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

cards.name: Friends in Hisui
cards.text: Draw 3 cards.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

cards.name: Friends in Sinnoh
cards.text: Draw 3 cards.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

cards.name: Professor's Research
cards.text: Professor Rowan

cards.name: Volo
cards.text: Discard 1 of your Benched Pokémon V and all attached cards.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

cards.name: Pikachu
cards.text: Pikachu that can generate powerful electricity have cheek sacs that are extra soft and super stretchy.

attacks.name: Wild Charge
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.
